results.text: He has shown you, O mortal, what is good. And what does the Lord require of you? To act justly and to love mercy and to walk humbly with your God.
results.reason: God calls us to love mercy as part of living a life pleasing to Him.
results.reflection: Loving mercy aligns us with God's desires and nurtures a humble spirit.

results.text: Blessed are the merciful, for they will be shown mercy.
results.reason: This verse highlights the reciprocal nature of mercy, suggesting that those who show mercy will receive it in return.
results.reflection: When we extend mercy, we open our hearts to receive the same grace from others.

results.text: For judgment is without mercy to one who has shown no mercy. Mercy triumphs over judgment.
results.reason: This verse emphasizes mercy's power to prevail over judgment, urging us to be compassionate.
results.reflection: Choosing mercy over judgment reflects God's own character and brings peace.

results.text: Be merciful, even as your Father is merciful.
results.reason: This commandment encourages us to emulate God's merciful nature in our interactions.
results.reflection: Reflecting God's mercy in our lives draws us closer to His heart.

results.text: Whoever pursues righteousness and love finds life, prosperity, and honor.
results.reason: Mercy is an expression of love, and this pursuit brings fulfillment and honor.
results.reflection: Living a life of mercy leads to true prosperity and life in abundance.
